notesStmt.note: Tidemarks at edges. Foxing. Usage stains and smeared ink. Slight signs of ink corrosion. Binding slightly rubbed at edges, corners, and joints.
End flyleaf: various notes and scribblings in Yiddish, partly crossed out.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Hebrew square and cursive, and Latin script of the 19th century. Meir ben Moses Kornik: an autograph.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Treatise on the Calendar. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Or. 4685.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Joseph Heinemann: purchased from him by the British Museum on 06 June 1893: inscribed, folio [336v].
